Package edu.ou.cs2334.project5.models

Class NonogramModel

java.lang.Object
edu.ou.cs2334.project5.models.NonogramModel
public class NonogramModel extends Object
This class encapsulates the state and rules of the game. It stores arrays with the row clues, column clues, and cell states (EMPTY, FILLED, or MARKED).
Version:
0.1
Author:
Joshua Wiseman

    • NonogramModel

      public NonogramModel(int[][] rowClues, int[][] colClues)
      Initializes the object using the given arrays of row and column clues.
      Parameters:
      rowClues - The clues given to help solve the rows.
      colClues - The clues given to help solve the columns.

    • NonogramModel

      public NonogramModel(File file) throws IOException
      Initializes the object using the row and column clues in the given file.
      Parameters:
      file - The file which contains the data necessary to make a Nonogram.
      Throws:
      IOException - Throws this exception if the file is not found.

    • NonogramModel

      public NonogramModel(String filename) throws IOException
      Initializes the object using the row and column clues in the text file with the given name.
      Parameters:
      filename - The file location which contains the data necessary to make a Nonogram.
      Throws:
      IOException - Throws this exception if the file is not found.

      Sets the state of the cell with the given indices.
      Parameters:
      rowIdx - Row index of the CellState.
      colIdx - Column index of the CellState.
      state - State which the cell will change to.
      Returns:
      Returns false if the CellState doesn't change and returns true if it does.
